    • Method Detail

      • iterateContent

        public boolean iterateContent(ContentIterator processor,
                              VirtualFileFilter filter)
        Description copied from interface: FileIndex
        Same as FileIndex.iterateContent(ContentIterator) but allows to pass filter to provide filtering in condition for directories.

        If filter returns false on a directory, the directory won't be processed, but iteration will go on.

        null filter means that all directories should be processed.

        Specified by:
        iterateContent in interface FileIndex
        Returns:
        false if files processing was stopped (ContentIterator.processFile(VirtualFile) returned false)

      • isExcluded

        public boolean isExcluded(VirtualFile file)
        Description copied from interface: ProjectFileIndex
        Checks if the specified file or directory is located under project roots but the file itself or one of its parent directories is either excluded from the project or ignored by FileTypeRegistry.isFileIgnored(VirtualFile)).
        Specified by:
        isExcluded in interface ProjectFileIndex
        Returns:
        true if file is excluded or ignored, false otherwise.

        Specified by:
        isUnderIgnored in interface ProjectFileIndex
        Returns:
        true if file is ignored, false otherwise.

      • isInSourceContent

        public boolean isInSourceContent(VirtualFile fileOrDir)

        Specified by:

      • isInTestSourceContent

        public boolean isInTestSourceContent(VirtualFile fileOrDir)
        Description copied from interface: FileIndex
        Returns true if fileOrDir is a file or directory located under a test sources or resources root and not excluded or ignored.

        Use this method when you really need to check whether the file is under test roots according to project configuration.

        If you want to determine whether file should be considered as test (e.g. for implementing SearchScope) you'd better use TestSourcesFilter.isTestSources(VirtualFile, Project) instead which includes FileIndex.isInTestSourceContent(VirtualFile) invocation.

        Specified by:
        isInTestSourceContent in interface FileIndex
        See Also:
        TestSourcesFilter.isTestSources(VirtualFile, Project)

      • isUnderSourceRootOfType

                                       java.util.Set<? extends JpsModuleSourceRootType<?>> rootTypes)
        Description copied from interface: FileIndex
        Returns true if fileOrDir is a file or directory located under a source root of type from rootTypes set and not excluded or ignored
        Specified by:

      • iterateContent

        public boolean iterateContent(ContentIterator processor)
        Description copied from interface: FileIndex
        Processes all files and directories under content roots skipping excluded and ignored files and directories.
        Specified by:
        iterateContent in interface FileIndex
        Returns:
        false if files processing was stopped (ContentIterator.processFile(VirtualFile) returned false)

      • iterateContentUnderDirectory

        public boolean iterateContentUnderDirectory(VirtualFile dir,
                                            ContentIterator processor,
                                            VirtualFileFilter customFilter)
        Description copied from interface: FileIndex
        Same as FileIndex.iterateContentUnderDirectory(VirtualFile, ContentIterator) but allows to pass additional customFilter to the iterator, in case you need to skip some file system branches using your own logic. If customFilter returns false on a directory, it won't be processed, but iteration will go on.

        null filter means that all directories should be processed.

        Specified by:
        iterateContentUnderDirectory in interface FileIndex

      • iterateContentUnderDirectory

        public boolean iterateContentUnderDirectory(VirtualFile dir,
                                            ContentIterator processor)
        Description copied from interface: FileIndex
        Processes all files and directories in the content under directory dir (including the directory itself) skipping excluded and ignored files and directories. Does nothing if dir is not in the content.
        Specified by:
        iterateContentUnderDirectory in interface FileIndex
        Returns:
        false if files processing was stopped (ContentIterator.processFile(VirtualFile) returned false)
